page.title: 09Mushroom Farm
page.content: At the Mushroom Farm two men showed us around.The farm is 7 acres and has been there for 23 years.To grow mushrooms they use horse and chicken manure.The manure takes 5 weeks to prepare.After 2 weeks it is put in a room and heated to 160 degrees to kill germs.After it has cooled down wheat or millet seeds covered with mushroom spores are put in.Chalk,peat and water are put on top. One week later tiny mushrooms appear all over.From this manure they are able to get 8 crops before new batch is needed.They have 5 men,13 women and 4 boys to prepare,grow and pick 1600 boxes (3lb),each week from the 13 growing sheds
